alert.note: Alert for Gilmer (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 4:21AM EST until February 04 at 11:20AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Coosawattee River near Ellijay affecting Gilmer County. For the Coosawattee River Basin...including Ellijay...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Coosawattee River near Ellijay. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 8 feet, Flood Stage is reached and minor flooding begins upstream and downstream from the gage off Legion Road. Some flooding will begin in low spots along the walking trail of the Harold Hefner River Park and in the parking lot of the American Legion Post 82 on Legion Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 AM EST Friday was 8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 5.7 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.2 feet on 02/17/1942. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
